s.text: Other drugs for the hyperhungry are on the way.
Fenfluramine increases the brain's serotonin levels (Prozac does, too, but not as dramatically) to produce a sense of satiety.
In evolutionary terms, this makes sense.
Not surprisingly, when the obese patients stopped taking these drugs, their weights returned to baseline levels.

Without leptin to signal satiety, the children in this family eat ravenously.
It seemed that obese people's only option was a combination of starvation and exercise, while skinny people got to feast and watch television.
